intro: Kaluhaburunghos stipularis, commonly known as the Stipularis Borer Tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically arranged in an alternate pattern along the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fruit that contains several seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant has a distinctive stipular structure, which is a modified leaf-like structure at the base of the petiole.
